title: Emerging-Markets Currencies Stay Strong Despite Dollar’s Rise
sub_head: The Brazilian real, Chilean peso and others are benefiting from higher commodity prices and global trade disruptions
body:
A strong U.S. dollar isn’t driving emerging-markets currencies into a tailspin. That is unusual.
Returns on emerging-markets currencies are higher than on those from developed economies since January, according to data compiled by Barclays . The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the U.S. dollar against a basket of currencies, is up nearly 6% year to date, reaching levels unseen in decades as inflation and worries of slower growth grip the globe.
